Key Match Events: Aiden Markram scored a crucial half-century
South Africa survived a late charge to win by one wicket
Pakistan fell to their fourth successive defeat
Shaheen Afridi took 3 wickets for 45 runs
Tabraiz Shamsi was the player of the match with 4 wickets for 60 runs
Usama Mir came on as a concussion substitute and took 2 wickets for 45 runs
Haris Rauf nearly won it for Pakistan towards the end with a diving catch
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa skipper Bavuma said they would need to address their issues
Pakistan team director Mickey Arthur warned against a 'witch-hunt' of his team
Pakistan captain Babar said they would try their best in their next three matches
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan were in trouble at 141-5 but Saud Shakeel and Shadab stitched together an 84-run stand
Pakistan were undone at the end by the impressive Shamsi and Gerald Coetzee
Arthur said slipping to 250-8 after looking comfortable at one stage was a problem of South Africaâ€™s own making
Others: The match was played at the MA Chidambaram Stadium
The match was a World Cup clash between Pakistan and South Africa
The match was South Africa's fifth win in six matches
